body:
Is their any advantage in pvp if I change my field of view?
For Example 90 or Quake pro.
body_tagged:
Is their any advantage in pvp if I change my field of view?
For Example 90 or Quake pro.
title: Field of view (FOV)

replies.body: 85 Will be the most beneficial, never ever use Quake Pro or normal.
replies.body_tagged: 85 Will be the most beneficial, never ever use Quake Pro or normal.

replies.body: Tbh, it's not really a whole big deal that shouldn't take up three whole pages of forum debate, like it has before. Just use what you like. I myself find that Normal - 80 works the best for me, but that's usually because I play older versions of MC a lot, and am too lazy to change my settings half the time when I change back.
replies.body_tagged: Tbh, it's not really a whole big deal that shouldn't take up three whole pages of forum debate, like it has before. Just use what you like. I myself find that Normal - 80 works the best for me, but that's usually because I play older versions of MC a lot, and am too lazy to change my settings half the time when I change back.

replies.body: Why never use Quake Pro or normal?
replies.body_tagged: Why never use Quake Pro or normal?

replies.body: I have always used Normal, idk why I just like it and have gotten used to it
replies.body_tagged: I have always used Normal, idk why I just like it and have gotten used to it

replies.body: Quake Pro destroys your aim and Normal makes some people feel ill.
replies.body_tagged: Quake Pro destroys your aim and Normal makes some people feel ill.

reply_to.body: Why never use Quake Pro or normal?
reply_to.body_tagged: Why never use Quake Pro or normal?

replies.body: I use normal. I used to use QP but oh my lord... qp with speed II is painful to the naked eye.
replies.body_tagged: I use normal. I used to use QP but oh my lord... qp with speed II is painful to the naked eye.

replies.body:
I've used Quake Pro for a while and I've been PvPing fine, however recently I tried switching to lower settings like 100. Currently trying to adjust to 90 slowly by lowering the FOV down by 1 every few minutes, so far it's been going pretty good and it helps a lot in Speed II fights.

But, it's really down to personal preference most often.
replies.body_tagged:
I've used Quake Pro for a while and I've been PvPing fine, however recently I tried switching to lower settings like 100. Currently trying to adjust to 90 slowly by lowering the FOV down by 1 every few minutes, so far it's been going pretty good and it helps a lot in Speed II fights.

But, it's really down to personal preference most often.

replies.body:
Hit boxes are the same, no matter what. It's just the skin that looks different, use F3 and B to see the hitboxes.
I prefer quake pro, it makes it seem a LOT faster than normal, and normal looks like Optifine's zoom feature.
replies.body_tagged:
Hit boxes are the same, no matter what. It's just the skin that looks different, use F3 and B to see the hitboxes.
I prefer quake pro, it makes it seem a LOT faster than normal, and normal looks like Optifine's zoom feature.

replies.body:
I use Quake Pro - normal pvp
I use 95-100 - pot pvp (speed)
replies.body_tagged:
I use Quake Pro - normal pvp
I use 95-100 - pot pvp (speed)

replies.body: Actually some people like broker and me can use QP or normal and do fine. It's a matter of personal preference. I lowered my FOV from 85 to normal and I can strafe/combo much better.
replies.body_tagged: Actually some people like broker and me can use QP or normal and do fine. It's a matter of personal preference. I lowered my FOV from 85 to normal and I can strafe/combo much better.

replies.body: Gibbo, QP doesnt mess up my aim at all. Iv been using it for like 8 months.
replies.body_tagged: Gibbo, QP doesnt mess up my aim at all. Iv been using it for like 8 months.

replies.body: I really like Quake Pro. If you want to get used to Quake Pro, Do what cinnamoncroc000 said but going up.
replies.body_tagged: I really like Quake Pro. If you want to get used to Quake Pro, Do what cinnamoncroc000 said but going up.
